articles.title: Meeting of Agricultural Workers Held
articles.content:
Meeting of Agricultural Workers Held
 Haeju, November 29 (KCNA) -- Agricultural workers met in Haeju City Sunday to vow to greet the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) with unprecedented labor feats. 
					 Present at the meeting were Pak Yong Ho, chief secretary of the South Hwanghae Provincial Committee of the WPK, officials concerned, agricultural workers and officials of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea in the province. 
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that they would make the historic congress of the party an important occasion of bringing about unprecedented achievement in agricultural production.
					
					 The outlines for the socialist emulation were made public at the meeting.

articles.title: Korean Central History Museum Marks 70th Anniversary
articles.content:
Korean Central History Museum Marks 70th Anniversary 
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- 70 years have passed since the Korean Central History Museum was inaugurated. 
					 More than 10 million people, overseas Koreans and foreigners have visited the museum during the period. 
					
					 The Korean Central History Museum was established by President Kim Il Sung on December 1, Juche 34 (1945). It has turned into a reliable base for preserving the cultural heritages of the nation and a center for education in history under the care of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu as it implants the Korean-nation-first spirit into the minds of the people and school youth and children. 
					
					 On display there are historic relics presented by compatriots in south Korea and from overseas to the President.

articles.title: Enlarged Plenary Meeting of GFTUK Held
articles.content:
Enlarged Plenary Meeting of GFTUK Held
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The 80th enlarged plenary meeting of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea (GFTUK) took place here on Sunday. 
					 Present there were members and alternate members of the Central Committee of the GFTUK and its officials in Pyongyang and local areas.
					
					 The meeting discussed the issue of greeting the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) with high political enthusiasm and unprecedented labor achievements.
					
					 A report was made by Ju Yong Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the GFTUK, to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that the 7th Congress of the WPK would be a historic landmark of great significance in bringing about a great surge in building a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, further strengthening the WPK into the party of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and bringing earlier the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 They proposed tasks and ways for greeting the 7th Congress of the WPK with signal achievements in the work of the unions.

articles.title: New York Times Raps "Yusin" Dictatorship in S. Korea
articles.content:
New York Times Raps "Yusin" Dictatorship in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- Kyunghyang Daily News and other south Korean newspapers simultaneously carried an editorial of the New York Times critical of the south Korean regime's "yusin" dictatorial rule.
					 The New York Times in its editorial on Nov. 19 referred to the public opinion from overseas saying that the greatest threatening factor in south Korea is the "government's" power-backed dictatorship.
					
					 The editorial cited the introduction of "state-compiled" history textbook, "revision of labor law" and control over dissident public opinion on internet as examples of repressive measures taken by the present "regime."
					
					 It termed the south Korean chief executive's moves to introduce the above-said textbook an attempt to embellish the "yusin" dictatorship of her father Park Chung Hee.
					
					 It also described the attempts of south Korea and Japan to rewrite history textbooks as dangerous.
					
					 The south Korean "regime's revision of the labor law" was the action to modify it in such a way as to enable big businesses to sack workers as they please, it noted, and went on: 
					
					 Many south Koreans turned out in the actions in protest against the "regime's" repressive rule.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Probe Truth about Ferry Sewol Disaster
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Probe Truth about Ferry Sewol Disaster
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The April 16 Solidarity of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on November 26 to denounce the authorities for disturbing the probe into the truth behind the ferry Sewol disaster. 
					 Speakers there referred to a document of the Ministry of Oceans and Fisheries, "guidelines" for members of the Ad Hoc Committee for Probing the Truth behind the Ferry Sewol Disaster chosen by the "Saenuri Party" which was opened to public recently. 
					
					 The document proves the fact that the "government" controlled members of the committee and obstructed the probe into the truth behind the ferry Sewol disaster and this action is absolutely unpardonable, the speakers charged. 
					
					 Then a letter of protest to the members of the committee was read out. 
					
					 It accused the members of the committee of disturbing the probe into truth behind the disaster after being reduced to puppets of the Chongwadae and the above-said ministry. 
					
					 The bereaved families of victims of the ferry Sewol disaster and solidarity organizations will struggle till the pent-up grudge of the children who met grievous deaths is settled, the letter stressed.

articles.title: U.S. Moves for Nuclear War under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. Moves for Nuclear War under Fire
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- South Korean online paper Jaju Sibo on Nov. 26 in an article laid bare the U.S. moves for a nuclear war. 
					 The international community is concerned about the U.S. which is manufacturing new type nuclear bombs, while publicly advocating a "world without nuclear weapons," the article said, and continued:
					
					 Shortly ago, the U.S. National Nuclear Security Administration opened to public the test of the B61-12 conducted by the U.S.
					
					 Referring to the destructive power and danger of the nuclear bomb, the article noted that military experts were sure the U.S. would use it in contingency.
					
					 Recalling that the U.S. is seriously violating the NPT as the nuclear bomb which had undergone a test would be used not only by the U.S. but by NATO member states, the article said: 
					
					 There are growing voices critical of the U.S. for deceiving the international community, it added.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Letter Introduced by German Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Letter Introduced by German Organization
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany on November 23 posted on its homepage the full text of Marshal Kim Jong Un's letter to the participants in the fourth conference of forerunners of the Three-revolution Red Flag Movement "Let Us Bring About a Fundamental Turn in the Three-Revolution Red Flag Movement in Line with the Demands of the Developing Revolution".
					 The letter sent by him on Nov. 20, Juche 104 (2015) recalls that President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il initiated the three-revolution red flag movement and wisely led the work for dynamically conducting the three revolutions-- ideological, technological and cultural-- in all fields of the revolution and construction, thus performing undying feats in the revolutionary cause of Juche and in the drive for accomplishing the cause of building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 The work indicates tasks for thoroughly carrying out the line of the three revolutions to bring earlier the final victory.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Guinea, Ethiopia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Guinea, Ethiopia
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A lecture was given at the Almami Samori Toure Barracks of the Guinean Army, seminars were held by branches of the Ethiopian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and round-table talks by a hospital in Ethiopia from November 19 to 21 on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 A commander of the Almami Samori Toure Barracks of the Guinean Army gave a lecture titled "Leader always remembered by people."
					
					 He said that leader Kim Jong Il was the greatest man who performed great exploits for the country and its people. He went on:
					
					 The years since his demise were a period in which profound yearning and reverence for him were expressed by all peoples.
					
					 He developed the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung in depth with his rare wisdom and energetic leadership, glorifying it as the guiding idea in the era of independence and turning the Workers' Party of Korea into an ever-victorious party and the DPRK into a powerful state which achieved the single-hearted unity.
					
					 He was the father of the people who dedicated himself to the happiness of the popular masses, finding himself among them all his life. 
					
					 He is always remembered not only by the Korean people but also by the world progressive people while socialist Korea will prosper forever.
					
					 The chief of a branch of the Ethiopian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism said in his speech that the idea and exploits of Kim Jong Il are shining more brilliantly thanks to supreme leader Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered by Syrian Political Party
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered by Syrian Political Party
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A committee of the Socialist Unionist Party of Syria for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was inaugurated on November 15.
					 Adnan Ismail, general secretary of the party, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Romania
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Romania
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A Romanian committee for remembering General Kim Jong Il was formed in Bucharest on November 18.
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Romanian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to have the brief biography of leader Kim Jong Il introduced by media and organize remembrance events including seminar, lecture and meeting during the period from November 25 and December 17.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Tajikistan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Tajikistan
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il was formed in Dushanbe, Tajikistan on November 23.
					 Shabdolov, chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize diverse events including a remembrance meeting and seminar on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Swiss Bodies Support Statement of Spokesman for Policy Department of NDC of DPRK
articles.content:
Swiss Bodies Support Statement of Spokesman for Policy Department of NDC of DPRK 
 Pyongyang, November 29 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement on Nov. 25 in support of the statement of the spokesman for the Policy Department of the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK.
					 Noting that the south Korean authorities retracted their plan for live shell firing toward waters of the DPRK side for fear of its retaliatory action but staged a provocative firing drill in the waters around the five islands in the West Sea, the most sensitive area, the statement said:
					
					 What merits a more serious attention is that they held a "memorial service" in Seoul on the fifth anniversary of the Yonphyong Island shelling incident.
					
					 At the "service" they didn't utter even a word of apology for the provocations they perpetrated for aggression against the DPRK five years ago, but shamelessly worked hard to shift the blame for the incident onto the DPRK.
					
					 What touched off irrepressible resentment was that the south Korean warmongers committed the act of hurting the dignity of its supreme leadership, not content with recklessly tearing to pieces the flag of the DPRK in the heart of Seoul, sins that deserve punishment by Heaven.
					
					 Such military and political saber-rattling go to prove that they have no idea of observing the inter-Korean agreement while persistently pursing the confrontation policy of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean warmongers would be held fully accountable for the consequences to be entailed by their provocations.
